questions.title: What is Spring and what are its benefits?
questions.answer: Spring is a framework that provides a lot of features and functionality for building enterprise-level applications. It provides a wide range of features that make it easier to develop and deploy Spring-based applications.

questions.title: What is the difference between Spring and Spring Boot?
questions.answer: Spring is a framework that provides a lot of features and functionality for building enterprise-level applications. Spring Boot is built on top of the Spring framework and provides a simpler and faster way to build Spring-based applications.

questions.title: What are the advantages of using Spring Boot for developing Java web applications?
questions.answer: Spring Boot simplifies and accelerates the development of Java web applications by providing defaults and auto-configuration, reducing boilerplate code, and offering a wide range of pre-built components for various tasks, including embedded web servers and database access.

questions.title: What is inversion of control (IoC) in Spring?
questions.answer: Inversion of control (IoC) is a design pattern in which the control of object creation and dependency injection is moved from the application code to a framework like Spring.

questions.title: What is dependency injection (DI) in Spring?
questions.answer: Dependency injection (DI) is a design pattern in which the dependencies of an object are injected into it by a framework like Spring.

questions.title: What is the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern, and how does Spring MVC implement it?
questions.answer: MVC is a design pattern that separates an application into three interconnected components: Model (business logic/data), View (presentation), and Controller (handles requests). Spring MVC provides a framework for building web applications following this pattern.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the @Autowired annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: The @Autowired annotation in Spring is used for automatic dependency injection. It allows Spring to automatically inject a dependency (such as another bean or a service) into a Spring-managed component, reducing the need for manual wiring.

questions.title: What is the use of @Value annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @Value is used to inject values from properties files or environment variables into a Spring-managed bean.

questions.title: What is the use of @Transactional annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @Transactional is used to mark a method as transactional, which means that the method will be executed within a transaction.

questions.title: What is the use of @ExceptionHandler annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @ExceptionHandler is used to handle exceptions that occur during the execution of a Spring MVC controller.

questions.title: How can you handle exceptions in a Spring Boot application?
questions.answer: Spring Boot provides exception handling mechanisms like @ExceptionHandler and global exception handling using @ControllerAdvice.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the @RequestMapping annotation in Spring MVC?
questions.answer: @RequestMapping is used to map a URL request to a specific method in a Spring Controller. It defines the URL path and HTTP methods that trigger the execution of the method.

questions.title: What is the use of @PathVariable annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @PathVariable is used to extract a variable from the URL in Spring MVC.

questions.title: What is the use of @RequestBody annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @RequestBody is used to extract the request body from an HTTP request in Spring MVC.

questions.title: Explain the concept of Spring Boot Starters.
questions.answer: Spring Boot Starters are pre-configured templates that include a set of dependencies for specific tasks or functionality. They simplify project setup by providing ready-to-use configurations and dependencies, such as those for web development, data access, or messaging.

questions.title: What is the Spring Boot Actuator, and what are some common endpoints provided by it?
questions.answer: Spring Boot Actuator is a set of production-ready features for monitoring and managing Spring Boot applications. Common endpoints include /health (application health), /metrics (application metrics), and /info (application information).

questions.title: Explain the concept of Spring Cloud in the context of microservices.
questions.answer: Spring Cloud is a set of tools and libraries within the Spring ecosystem that simplifies building and deploying microservices-based applications. It provides features like service discovery, load balancing, configuration management, and distributed tracing.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the @RestController annotation in Spring Boot, and how does it differ from @Controller?
questions.answer: The @RestController annotation in Spring Boot is used to create RESTful web services that produce JSON or XML responses. It combines @Controller and @ResponseBody, making it more convenient for building REST APIs compared to using @Controller.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the @ComponentScan annotation in Spring Framework?
questions.answer: The @ComponentScan annotation is used to instruct Spring to scan and discover Spring-managed components (such as beans, controllers, and services) within a specific package and its subpackages, making them available for dependency injection and auto-wiring.

questions.title: Explain the purpose of Spring Boot Auto-configuration and provide an example of its usage.
questions.answer: Spring Boot Auto-configuration automatically configures the application based on classpath dependencies. For example, if you include a JDBC driver on the classpath, Spring Boot will auto-configure a data source for you. It simplifies setup and reduces the need for manual configuration.

questions.title: What is the use of @CrossOrigin annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @CrossOrigin is used to enable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) in Spring MVC.

questions.title: What is the use of @Cacheable annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @Cacheable is used to cache the results of a method in Spring.

questions.title: Explain the concept of AOP (Aspect-Oriented Programming) in Spring.
questions.answer: AOP is a programming paradigm that allows you to modularize cross-cutting concerns (e.g., logging, security, transaction management) in your application. Spring AOP provides a way to apply aspects (cross-cutting behavior) to specific points in the code, like method invocations or exceptions.

questions.title: What is the use of @Scheduled annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @Scheduled is used to schedule a method to be executed at a fixed rate or at a fixed time in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @Async annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @Async is used to execute a method asynchronously in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @EnableScheduling annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @EnableScheduling is used to enable scheduling in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @EnableAsync annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @EnableAsync is used to enable asynchronous execution in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @EnableAutoConfiguration annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @EnableAutoConfiguration is used to enable auto-configuration in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @EnableConfigurationProperties annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @EnableConfigurationProperties is used to enable the use of @ConfigurationProperties in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @ConfigurationProperties annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @ConfigurationProperties is used to bind properties from a properties file or environment variables to a Spring-managed bean.

questions.title: What is the use of @ConditionalOnProperty annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @ConditionalOnProperty is used to conditionally enable a Spring-managed bean based on the value of a property.

questions.title: What is the use of @Entity annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @Entity is used to mark a class as a JPA entity in Spring.

questions.title: What is the use of @GeneratedValue annotation in Spring?
questions.answer: @GeneratedValue is used to specify the generation strategy for a JPA entity's primary key in Spring.

questions.title: What is the difference between @Component, @Service, and @Repository annotations in Spring Boot?
questions.answer: @Component is a generic annotation used for any Spring-managed component. @Service is used to mark a class as a service layer component. @Repository is used to mark a class as a data access layer component.

questions.title: What is the use of @Autowired annotation in Spring Boot?
questions.answer: @Autowired is used to inject dependencies automatically into a Spring-managed bean.

questions.title: What is Spring Data JPA, and how does it simplify data access in Spring Boot?
questions.answer: Spring Data JPA is a sub-project of Spring Data that simplifies database access using JPA (Java Persistence API) with the help of various repository interfaces and CRUD methods.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the Spring JDBC template in Spring Framework?
questions.answer: Spring JDBC template simplifies database access by providing methods for common database operations while handling connection management and exception handling.

questions.title: Explain the role of UserDetailsService in Spring Security.
questions.answer: UserDetailsService is an interface that Spring Security uses to retrieve user details. It is often implemented to load user information from a database.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the @SpringBootTest annotation in Spring Boot testing?
questions.answer: @SpringBootTest is used to create an application context for integration testing. It loads the complete Spring Boot application.

questions.title: What is CSRF protection, and how does Spring Boot handle it?
questions.answer: CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) protection is a security feature that prevents unauthorized requests. Spring Security provides CSRF protection by default.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the @MockBean annotation in Spring Boot testing?
questions.answer: @MockBean is used to create mock instances of beans. It is often used in integration tests to replace real beans with mock implementations.

questions.title: How can you secure a Spring Boot application?
questions.answer: You can secure a Spring Boot application using Spring Security, which allows you to configure authentication and authorization.
